Package eportfolio

Class Stock

java.lang.Object
eportfolio.Stock
public class Stock extends Object
This class is used for the stock data, containing stock information for symbol, name, quantity, price, and bookvalue

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Stock()
    This constructor is the default constructor and does not initialize any data for the stock
    Stock(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue)
    This constructor accepts data for the symbol, name quantity, price and book value of a stock and sets these to the Stock object's symbol, name quantity, price and book value

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    buy(int addedQuantity, double newPrice)
    This method performs a stock buy, adding the quantity bought to the previous quantity of the stock, updating price at the time of purchase, and calculates the bookvalue for the stock with fee of 9.99, adding it to the previous bookValue
    boolean
    equals(Stock stockCompare)
    Checks if two stocks are equal in terms of all attributes
    double
    getBookValue()
    This method will return the current value of the stock's book value
    double
    getGain(int sellQuantity, double salePrice)
    This method calculates the theoretical gain of a stock (as if it were a full sale) and returns it to be printed in main (sale fee of 9.99 included)
    String
    getName()
    This method will return the current value of the stock's name
    double
    getPrice()
    This method will return the current value of the stock's price
    int
    getQuantity()
    This method will return the current value of the stock's quanity
    String
    getSymbol()
    This method will return the current value of the stock's symbol
    double
    sell(int sellQuantity, double salePrice, ArrayList<Stock> inputList, int i)
    This method performs a stock sell, either partial or full if the quanitity parameter is not larger than the quantity of stock owned FULL SALE: sets quantity and bookValue to zero and removes stock PARTIAL SALE: sets remaining quanitity after sale, updates price to the price at which stock was sold, and calculates the remaining book value of the stock
    void
    setBookValue(double bookValue)
    This method will set the current of value of the bookValue to the double value passed in

    toString()

  • Constructor Details

    • Stock

      public Stock()
      This constructor is the default constructor and does not initialize any data for the stock

    • Stock

      public Stock(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue)
      This constructor accepts data for the symbol, name quantity, price and book value of a stock and sets these to the Stock object's symbol, name quantity, price and book value
      Parameters:
      symbol - - string value for the symbol
      name - - string value for the name
      quantity - - int value for the quantity
      price - - double value for the price
      bookValue - - double for the book value

    • buy

      public double buy(int addedQuantity, double newPrice)
      This method performs a stock buy, adding the quantity bought to the previous quantity of the stock, updating price at the time of purchase, and calculates the bookvalue for the stock with fee of 9.99, adding it to the previous bookValue
      Parameters:
      addedQuantity - - the quantity of stock bought
      newPrice - - the price at which stock was bought
      Returns:
      the bookvalue of the purchase (fee of $9.99)

    • sell

      public double sell(int sellQuantity, double salePrice, ArrayList<Stock> inputList, int i)
      This method performs a stock sell, either partial or full if the quanitity parameter is not larger than the quantity of stock owned FULL SALE: sets quantity and bookValue to zero and removes stock PARTIAL SALE: sets remaining quanitity after sale, updates price to the price at which stock was sold, and calculates the remaining book value of the stock
      Parameters:
      sellQuantity - - the quantity of stock bought
      salePrice - - the price at which stock was bought
      inputList - - for removal of stock at full sale
      i - - index of arrayList of stocks to remove at full sale
      Returns:
      the gain of the partial or full sale of the stock

    • getGain

      public double getGain(int sellQuantity, double salePrice)
      This method calculates the theoretical gain of a stock (as if it were a full sale) and returns it to be printed in main (sale fee of 9.99 included)
      Parameters:
      sellQuantity - - the theoretical quantity being sold
      salePrice - - the theoretical sale price
      Returns:
      theoretical gain of the stock

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Displays all information of the stock neatly
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      all information of the stock

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Stock stockCompare)
      Checks if two stocks are equal in terms of all attributes
      Parameters:
      stockCompare - is the other stock in the comparison (stock1.equals(compareStock))
      Returns:
      true or falls depending if equal or not
